overview_of_class: Students will work on literary and historical analysis, philosophy, art history, epigraphy, papyrology, numismatics, and the development of critical reading and writing skills, The subject matter for fall 2016 is a series of major questions from Athens 508-461 BC, including Athens' first democracy and democratic ideology; the growth of Athens' imperial power; did the Athenians invent "orientalism" (in this case, dislike of the Persians)?; male vs. female. Readings include two early tragedies, Aeschylus' Persians and Suppliant Women. No exams, but several brief essays and a final paper. No Greek or Latin required. Recommended for juniors, seniors, and ambitious sophomores. Required for the major.
